subject: Education
title: The Marshmallow Test Revisited
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Marshmallow Test Revisited.

hook.text: Wait 15 minutes for two marshmallows or eat one now? The original study predicted life success.

buildup.text: Walter Mischel's 1972 experiment linked delayed gratification to SAT scores and income decades later.

discovery.text: Children who waited used strategiesâ€”looking away, singing, pretending the marshmallow was a cloud.

twist.text: A 2018 replication found the effect mostly disappears when you control for family wealth.

climax.text: Self-control matters, but so does growing up in an environment where waiting is rewarded.

punchline.text: Patience is a skill and a privilegeâ€”not everyone can afford to wait.
